result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly J. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kimberly J. Peterson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kimberly J. Peterson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
02:10 pm - Defendant Kimberly J. Peterson in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf14 and 14cf149.  State moves to dismiss count 2 in case 14c149 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to remaining two counts.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Hogan/Bednar/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 3 yrs - CC
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
AODA assessment and recovery
Jail credit 2 days 14cf149
Jail credit 1 day 14cf14
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights/NADVI given

11:14 am - Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf14 and 14cf149.  Hogan states rec'd call from defendant - car trouble is causing delay.  Court sets for 1:30 p.m.

02:17 pm - Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf14 and 14cf149.  Bednar believes case was resolved - Defendant is currently incarcerated in Milwaukee County.  Currently set for jury trial on February 6th.  Court authorizes warrant if defendant does not appear on the 24th.  Court removes jury trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Sara, ONSO Dispatch, notified to quash warrant, made voluntary appearance.

03:0 pm - Defendant Kimberly J. Peterson in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf14 and 14cf149.  Court questions defendant as to non-appearance on December 2nd - Defendant states was hospitalized.  Defendant was then scheduled for 1:30 p.m. - Defendant states got lost on the way up today.  Hogan states case is not yet resolved.  Hopes case will still be resolved prior to jury trial.  MIchlig/Hogan statement to bond.  Court quashes warrant and reinstates the $500 cash bond.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

01:31 pm - Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf14 and 14cf149.  Hogan states does not know why defendant is not present - did have contact with defendant this past week several time over the phone.  Defendant states to Hogan was hospitalized and was going to bring documentation.  Warrant remains active.

11:50 a.m. Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court. Defendant does not appear. Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14CF14. Hogan statement as to defendant's non-appearance. Schiek statement; requests warrant. Court authorizes warrant. Hogan requests trial date in 14CF14. Status conference 2/6/15 at 8:30 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on December 2, 2014 at 11:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

11:05 am - Defendant Kimberly J. Peterson in court with attorney Mary M. Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information, Hogan in receipt, waives reading.  Hogen enters not guilty pleas on behalf of defendant.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Includes 14cf14

01:36 pm - Defendant Kimberly J. Peterson in court with attorney Mary M. Hogan.  Defendant Kimberly J. Peterson in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf14 and 14cf149 (Initial Appr).  In 14cf149 -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing.  In 14cf14 - Court questions defendant as to non-appearance on August 5th - Defendant lives in Manitowoc and states was having automobile trouble.  Schiek/Hogan to bond.  Court sets $500 cash bond includes both cases.  
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Per Mary - in custody Manitowoc County - on detainer.
